Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>Interesting, thanks Charles.  So if you get a novel game and right 
>away need to play it with no prior experience, how can an 
>evolutionary system be prepared for that?  Are you trying to evolve 
>a single neural network that can play any game?  I'm still unclear 
>how this can be accomplished.
>  
>

Ken,

I suppose one answer to this is to use rtNEAT to evolve players 
alongside the main player/game. It should/might be possible to do this 
because I undertstand you are handed a file that defines how to play the 
game. Sounds like some serious (e.g. parallel) CPU would be required to 
evolve good enough players in the time frame of a game, you are also 
more likely to make stupid moves early on in a game, and this t could 
scupper your chances of doing well.

Colin.
